trans-unit.source: Federation Metadata
trans-unit.target: Federation Metadata

trans-unit.source: A description of metadata endpoints and the content in the metadata document that services that accept Azure AD tokens must use.
trans-unit.target: A description of metadata endpoints and the content in the metadata document that services that accept Azure AD tokens must use.

trans-unit.source: Federation Metadata
trans-unit.target: Federation Metadata

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) publishes a federation metadata document for services that are configured to accept the security tokens that Azure Active Directory issues.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) publishes a federation metadata document for services that are configured to accept the security tokens that Azure Active Directory issues.

trans-unit.source: The federation metadata document format is described in the <link><linkText>Web Services Federation Language (WS-Federation) Version 1.2</linkText><title></title></link>, which extends <link><linkText>Metadata for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) V2.0</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The federation metadata document format is described in the <link><linkText>Web Services Federation Language (WS-Federation) Version 1.2</linkText><title></title></link>, which extends <link><linkText>Metadata for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) V2.0</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This topic lists the metadata endpoints and explains the content in the metadata document that services that accept Azure AD tokens need to use.
trans-unit.target: This topic lists the metadata endpoints and explains the content in the metadata document that services that accept Azure AD tokens need to use.

trans-unit.source: Tenant-Specific and Tenant-Independent Metadata Endpoints
trans-unit.target: Tenant-Specific and Tenant-Independent Metadata Endpoints

trans-unit.source: Azure AD publishes tenant-specific and tenant-independent endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD publishes tenant-specific and tenant-independent endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Tenant-specific endpoints are designed for a particular tenant.
trans-unit.target: Tenant-specific endpoints are designed for a particular tenant.

trans-unit.source: The tenant-specific federation metadata includes information about the tenant, including tenant-specific issuer and endpoint information.
trans-unit.target: The tenant-specific federation metadata includes information about the tenant, including tenant-specific issuer and endpoint information.

trans-unit.source: Applications that restrict access to a single tenant use tenant-specific endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Applications that restrict access to a single tenant use tenant-specific endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Tenant-independent endpoints provide information that is common to all Azure AD tenants.
trans-unit.target: Tenant-independent endpoints provide information that is common to all Azure AD tenants.

trans-unit.source: This information applies to tenants hosted at login.windows.net and is shared across tenants.
trans-unit.target: This information applies to tenants hosted at login.windows.net and is shared across tenants.

trans-unit.source: Tenant-independent endpoints are recommended for multi-tenant applications, since they are not associated with any particular tenant.
trans-unit.target: Tenant-independent endpoints are recommended for multi-tenant applications, since they are not associated with any particular tenant.

trans-unit.source: Federation Metadata Endpoints
trans-unit.target: Federation Metadata Endpoints

trans-unit.source: Azure AD publishes federation metadata at *https://login.windows.net/<html></html>/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml*,where the value of <html></html> can be "common" or a tenant-specific value.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD publishes federation metadata at *https://login.windows.net/<html></html>/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml*,where the value of <html></html> can be "common" or a tenant-specific value.

trans-unit.source: The endpoints are addressable, so you can go to the address site to view the federation metadata for a tenant.
trans-unit.target: The endpoints are addressable, so you can go to the address site to view the federation metadata for a tenant.

trans-unit.source: For tenant-specific endpoints, the can be one of the following types:
trans-unit.target: For tenant-specific endpoints, the can be one of the following types:

trans-unit.source: A registered domain name of an Azure AD tenant, such as: contoso.onmicrosoft.com.
trans-unit.target: A registered domain name of an Azure AD tenant, such as: contoso.onmicrosoft.com.

trans-unit.source: The immutable tenant id of the domain, such as 72f988bf-86f1-41af-91ab-2d7cd011db45.
trans-unit.target: The immutable tenant id of the domain, such as 72f988bf-86f1-41af-91ab-2d7cd011db45.

trans-unit.source: For tenant-independent endpoints, the is common. This name indicates that only the Federation Metadata elements that are common to all Azure AD tenants that are hosted at login.windows.net.
trans-unit.target: For tenant-independent endpoints, the is common. This name indicates that only the Federation Metadata elements that are common to all Azure AD tenants that are hosted at login.windows.net.

trans-unit.source: For example, a tenant-specific endpoint might be https://login.windows.net/contoso.onmicrosoft.comFederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml.
trans-unit.target: For example, a tenant-specific endpoint might be https://login.windows.net/contoso.onmicrosoft.comFederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml.

trans-unit.source: The tenant-independent endpoint is https://login.windows.net/common/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml.
trans-unit.target: The tenant-independent endpoint is https://login.windows.net/common/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml.

trans-unit.source: Contents of Federation Metadata
trans-unit.target: Contents of Federation Metadata

trans-unit.source: The following section provides information needed by services that consume the tokens issued by Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The following section provides information needed by services that consume the tokens issued by Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: EntityID
trans-unit.target: EntityID

trans-unit.source: The EntityDescriptor element contains an EntityID attribute.
trans-unit.target: The EntityDescriptor element contains an EntityID attribute.

trans-unit.source: The value of the EntityID attribute represents the issuer, that is, the security token service (STS) that issued the token.
trans-unit.target: The value of the EntityID attribute represents the issuer, that is, the security token service (STS) that issued the token.

trans-unit.source: It is important to validate the issuer so you can confirm which tenant issued a token.
trans-unit.target: It is important to validate the issuer so you can confirm which tenant issued a token.

trans-unit.source: The following metadata shows a sample tenant-specific EntityDescriptor element with an EntityID element.
trans-unit.target: The following metadata shows a sample tenant-specific EntityDescriptor element with an EntityID element.

trans-unit.source: The EntityID in the tenant-independent endpoint provides a template that can be used to generate a tenant-specific EntityID value.
trans-unit.target: The EntityID in the tenant-independent endpoint provides a template that can be used to generate a tenant-specific EntityID value.

trans-unit.source: Replace the "{tenant}" literal in the tenant-independent endpoint with the value of the TenantID claim from a token.
trans-unit.target: Replace the "{tenant}" literal in the tenant-independent endpoint with the value of the TenantID claim from a token.

trans-unit.source: The resulting value will be the same as the token issuer.
trans-unit.target: The resulting value will be the same as the token issuer.

trans-unit.source: This strategy allows a multi-tenant application to validate the issuer for a given tenant.
trans-unit.target: This strategy allows a multi-tenant application to validate the issuer for a given tenant.

trans-unit.source: The following metadata shows a sample tenant-independent EntityID element.
trans-unit.target: The following metadata shows a sample tenant-independent EntityID element.

trans-unit.source: In this element, {tenant} is a literal, not a placeholder.
trans-unit.target: In this element, {tenant} is a literal, not a placeholder.

trans-unit.source: Token Signing Certificate
trans-unit.target: Token Signing Certificate

trans-unit.source: When a service receives a token that is issued by a Azure AD tenant, the signature of the token must be validated with a signing key that is published in the federation metadata document.
trans-unit.target: When a service receives a token that is issued by a Azure AD tenant, the signature of the token must be validated with a signing key that is published in the federation metadata document.

trans-unit.source: The federation metadata includes the public portion of the certificates that the tenants use for token signing.
trans-unit.target: The federation metadata includes the public portion of the certificates that the tenants use for token signing.

trans-unit.source: The certificate raw bytes appear in the KeyDescriptor element.
trans-unit.target: The certificate raw bytes appear in the KeyDescriptor element.

trans-unit.source: The token signing certificate is valid for signing only when the value of the use attribute is signing.
trans-unit.target: The token signing certificate is valid for signing only when the value of the use attribute is signing.

trans-unit.source: A federation metadata document published by Azure AD can have multiple signing keys , such as when Azure AD is preparing to update the signing certificate.
trans-unit.target: A federation metadata document published by Azure AD can have multiple signing keys , such as when Azure AD is preparing to update the signing certificate.

trans-unit.source: When a federation metadata document includes more than one certificate, a service that is validating the tokens should support all certificates in the document.
trans-unit.target: When a federation metadata document includes more than one certificate, a service that is validating the tokens should support all certificates in the document.

trans-unit.source: The following metadata shows a sample KeyDescriptor element with a signing key.
trans-unit.target: The following metadata shows a sample KeyDescriptor element with a signing key.

trans-unit.source: The KeyDescriptor element appears in two places in the federation metadata document; in the WS-Federation-specific section and the SAML-specific section.
trans-unit.target: The KeyDescriptor element appears in two places in the federation metadata document; in the WS-Federation-specific section and the SAML-specific section.

trans-unit.source: The certificates published in both sections will be the same.
trans-unit.target: The certificates published in both sections will be the same.

trans-unit.source: In the WS-Federation-specific section, a WS-Federation metadata reader would read the certificates from a RoleDescriptor element with the SecurityTokenServiceType type.
trans-unit.target: In the WS-Federation-specific section, a WS-Federation metadata reader would read the certificates from a RoleDescriptor element with the SecurityTokenServiceType type.

trans-unit.source: The following metadata shows a sample RoleDescriptor element.
trans-unit.target: The following metadata shows a sample RoleDescriptor element.

trans-unit.source: In the SAML-specific section, a WS-Federation metadata reader would read the certificates from a IDPSSODescriptor element.
trans-unit.target: In the SAML-specific section, a WS-Federation metadata reader would read the certificates from a IDPSSODescriptor element.

trans-unit.source: The following metadata shows a sample IDPSSODescriptor element.
trans-unit.target: The following metadata shows a sample IDPSSODescriptor element.

trans-unit.source: There are no differences in the format of tenant-specific and tenant-independent certificates.
trans-unit.target: There are no differences in the format of tenant-specific and tenant-independent certificates.

trans-unit.source: WS-Federation Endpoint URL
trans-unit.target: WS-Federation Endpoint URL

trans-unit.source: The federation metadata includes the URL that is Azure AD uses for single sign-in and single sign-out in WS-Federation protocol.
trans-unit.target: The federation metadata includes the URL that is Azure AD uses for single sign-in and single sign-out in WS-Federation protocol.

trans-unit.source: This endpoint appears in the PassiveRequestorEndpoint element.
trans-unit.target: This endpoint appears in the PassiveRequestorEndpoint element.

trans-unit.source: The following metadata shows a sample PassiveRequestorEndpoint element for a tenant-specific endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The following metadata shows a sample PassiveRequestorEndpoint element for a tenant-specific endpoint.

trans-unit.source: For the tenant-independent endpoint, the WS-Federation URL appears in the WS-Federation endpoint, as shown in the following sample.
trans-unit.target: For the tenant-independent endpoint, the WS-Federation URL appears in the WS-Federation endpoint, as shown in the following sample.

trans-unit.source: SAML Protocol Endpoint URL
trans-unit.target: SAML Protocol Endpoint URL

trans-unit.source: The federation metadata includes the URL that Azure AD uses for single sign-in and single sign-out in SAML 2.0 protocol.
trans-unit.target: The federation metadata includes the URL that Azure AD uses for single sign-in and single sign-out in SAML 2.0 protocol.

trans-unit.source: These endpoints appear in the IDPSSODescriptor element.
trans-unit.target: These endpoints appear in the IDPSSODescriptor element.

trans-unit.source: The sign-in and sign-out URLs appear in the SingleSignOnService and SingleLogoutService elements.
trans-unit.target: The sign-in and sign-out URLs appear in the SingleSignOnService and SingleLogoutService elements.

trans-unit.source: The following metadata shows a sample PassiveResistorEndpoint for a tenant-specific endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The following metadata shows a sample PassiveResistorEndpoint for a tenant-specific endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Similarly the endpoints for the common SAML 2.0 protocol endpoints are published in the tenant-independent federation metadata, as shown in the following sample.
trans-unit.target: Similarly the endpoints for the common SAML 2.0 protocol endpoints are published in the tenant-independent federation metadata, as shown in the following sample.
